meanings.sent1: The particularisms of her artwork made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent2: The detective paid attention to the particularisms of the crime scene to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The particularisms of his fashion sense always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of similarities, her particularisms shone like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: The particularisms of the ancient artifact fascinated the archaeologists.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unique or distinct
meanings.sent1: The particularisms of her personality made her a memorable character.
meanings.sent2: Each snowflake has its own particularisms, just like every person.
meanings.sent3: The particularisms of the quirky house made it a tourist attraction.
meanings.sent4: His particularisms in cooking made his dishes taste like magic.
meanings.sent5: The particularisms of the rare flower made it a prized possession for botanists.
